thread.title: FDA Approves Alexion's Metabolic Disorder Drug
thread.title_full: FDA Approves Alexion's Metabolic Disorder Drug

author: morningstar.com
title: FDA Approves Alexion's Metabolic Disorder Drug
text:
By Chelsey Dulaney
The U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Friday approved Alexion Pharmaceuticals Inc.'s Strensiq, an injectable drug that treats a rare metabolic disorder.
Strensiq is the first approved treatment for perinatal, infantile and juvenile-onset hypophosphatasia, or HPP, a rare genetic disease that can result in skeletal abnormalities and severe disabilities.
Severe HPP affects about one in 100,000 newborns, while milder cases happen in childhood or adulthood more frequently.
The FDA had granted the drug breakthrough therapy designation, which helps speed the review process for drugs that treat life-threatening conditions. Strensiq was also granted orphan drug designation.
In a study of 99 patients that spanned up to 6.5 years, patients who took Strensiq had improved survival, and improved rates of survival without the need of a ventilator.
Shares of Alexion, up 9% this month, were halted in afternoon trading.
Write to Chelsey Dulaney at Chelsey.Dulaney@wsj.com
 23, 2015 16:24 ET (20:24
